chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard L Causby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Credit For Time Served 43 Days.
Consecutive to: Counts #3 and #7.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No Violent contact with victim.
DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Domestic Violence Counseling.
No operation of a motor vehicle unless he has a valid driver's license.

Cases:  #15CT0676 and #15CT677 were Dismissed and Read into Case #15CF987.

records.addlTxt: Court denied defendant's Huber request.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 10/9/15 requesting Huber privileges.
45 days condition time without huber be imposed FORTHWITH.
Filed by DOC requesting 45 days stayed condition time be imposed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit - 43 Days.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Richard L Causby in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to counts 2, 3 and 7. Counts 1,4,5 and 6 are dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 MONTHS HUBER each count consecutive, w/Standard Release Conditions (CREDIT - 43 days ct. 2);

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  

*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment 
*No violent contact with:  the victim
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Domestic Violence Counseling
*No operation of a motor vehicle unless he has a valid driver's license

COURT COSTS: Ct. 2 $243.00 and $100.00 domestic abuse surcharge and $200.00 DNA Surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation);
                               Ct. 3 $243.00 and $100.00 domestic abuse surcharge and $200.00 DNA Surcharge and $10.00 DRGOD (to be paid as a condition of proation)
                               Ct. 7 $243.00 and $200.00 DNA Surcharge

CONDITION TIME: 45 DAYS WITH HUBER CT. 2, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-14-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Richard L Causby in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State to provide outstanding 911 call to Defense. Defense is ready to move on to plea/sentencing date before 09/18/2015. Court will give another date for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on September 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
